title: How to Buy Bonds on E Trade

steps.headline: Log on at www.us.etrade.com.
steps.description: If you do not already have an account, you will need to set one up. The instructions are easy to follow. Simply click on the green box that says Open An Account.

steps.headline: View the portfolio of bonds available for purchase.
steps.description: These will include U.S. Treasury bills and bonds, government agency and corporate bonds, municipal bonds and certificates of deposit. Use the Search function. Go to E*Trade's Bond Center and click on the tab that says "Search current bond offerings." Fill out the fields in the Quick Search form for a list of bonds that fit your requirements. You can also use the Advanced Search option to further define your search criteria. For example, you can limit your search to Treasury bonds or to bonds that will provide a particular yield.

steps.headline: Use the bond calculator.
steps.description: When you select a bond that interests you, you can get a calculated price and yield for that bond to help you plan your investment.

steps.headline: Note the CUSIP number of any bonds that interest you.
steps.description: This number will be needed to get information about a bond, get a quote or place an order. It is a nine-digit number assigned by the Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures.

methods.name: Requesting a Bond Quote on E*Trade

steps.headline: Submit a specific request for a bond quote.
steps.description: This is not the same as placing an order or buying a bond. Before you purchase a bond, you must get a price quote for it.

steps.headline: Click on "Get a Bond Quote" in the Bond Center.
steps.description: This will take you to the same screen where you would place your order, but you are not doing that yet.

steps.headline: Enter the number of bonds you would like your quote to include.
Provide the CUSIP numbers for the bonds you are interested in.
Choose the "Offer Quote Request" option.
steps.description: This will provide you with the lowest available bond prices.

steps.headline: Click on "Preview Quote Request."
steps.description: Make sure all of the information is accurate, particularly the CUSIP number. Once you have verified the information, click on "Place Order."

steps.headline: Wait for your quote to arrive on the "View Bond Orders" screen.
steps.description: E*Trade will scan the markets and provide you with the information you need. The process may take up to 15 minutes.

methods.name: Placing an Order to Purchase a Bond on E*Trade

steps.headline: Click on "Buy or Sell Bonds" in the Bond Center.
Decide whether you want to buy Treasury bonds at auction.
steps.description: Buy Treasury bonds at auction by clicking on the "Treasury Auction" page and entering the number of bonds you want to buy. Select the Treasury issue you wish to purchase from the list of options. Preview your order and then click "Place Order" when you're ready.

steps.headline: Buy non-auction bonds by choosing the "Buy" option from the "Buy or Sell Bonds" page.
Enter the number of bonds you want to buy and input the CUSIP numbers.
Decide whether you want to make a market order for the bond at an unspecified price or set the price you want for the bond.
steps.description: Input that number on the "Set Price" screen. Pay attention to minimum-denomination requirements. If the price you enter does not meet those requirements, you will be notified when you preview your order. For example, you must buy a full bond, not a fraction of a bond. They come in denominations starting at $1,000. Some bond dealers require a minimum purchase of as much as $10,000.

steps.headline: Confirm the details of your order on the "Preview Order" screen and click "Place Order" when you are ready to buy your bonds.
Look for a SmartAlert.
steps.description: Whether you bought Treasury bonds at auction or placed an order for other bonds, you will be notified of that trade as soon as it goes through. It should take only a few minutes.

text: Researching Available Bonds on E-Trade Log on at www.us.etrade.com. If you do not already have an account, you will need to set one up. The instructions are easy to follow. Simply click on the green box that says Open An Account. View the portfolio of bonds available for purchase. These will include U.S. Treasury bills and bonds, government agency and corporate bonds, municipal bonds and certificates of deposit. Use the Search function. Go to E*Trade's Bond Center and click on the tab that says "Search current bond offerings." Fill out the fields in the Quick Search form for a list of bonds that fit your requirements. You can also use the Advanced Search option to further define your search criteria. For example, you can limit your search to Treasury bonds or to bonds that will provide a particular yield. Use the bond calculator. When you select a bond that interests you, you can get a calculated price and yield for that bond to help you plan your investment. Note the CUSIP number of any bonds that interest you. This number will be needed to get information about a bond, get a quote or place an order. It is a nine-digit number assigned by the Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures. Requesting a Bond Quote on E*Trade Submit a specific request for a bond quote. This is not the same as placing an order or buying a bond. Before you purchase a bond, you must get a price quote for it. Click on "Get a Bond Quote" in the Bond Center. This will take you to the same screen where you would place your order, but you are not doing that yet. Enter the number of bonds you would like your quote to include.  Provide the CUSIP numbers for the bonds you are interested in.  Choose the "Offer Quote Request" option. This will provide you with the lowest available bond prices. Click on "Preview Quote Request." Make sure all of the information is accurate, particularly the CUSIP number. Once you have verified the information, click on "Place Order." Wait for your quote to arrive on the "View Bond Orders" screen. E*Trade will scan the markets and provide you with the information you need. The process may take up to 15 minutes. Placing an Order to Purchase a Bond on E*Trade Click on "Buy or Sell Bonds" in the Bond Center.  Decide whether you want to buy Treasury bonds at auction. Buy Treasury bonds at auction by clicking on the "Treasury Auction" page and entering the number of bonds you want to buy. Select the Treasury issue you wish to purchase from the list of options. Preview your order and then click "Place Order" when you're ready. Buy non-auction bonds by choosing the "Buy" option from the "Buy or Sell Bonds" page.  Enter the number of bonds you want to buy and input the CUSIP numbers.  Decide whether you want to make a market order for the bond at an unspecified price or set the price you want for the bond. Input that number on the "Set Price" screen. Pay attention to minimum-denomination requirements. If the price you enter does not meet those requirements, you will be notified when you preview your order. For example, you must buy a full bond, not a fraction of a bond. They come in denominations starting at $1,000. Some bond dealers require a minimum purchase of as much as $10,000. Confirm the details of your order on the "Preview Order" screen and click "Place Order" when you are ready to buy your bonds.  Look for a SmartAlert. Whether you bought Treasury bonds at auction or placed an order for other bonds, you will be notified of that trade as soon as it goes through. It should take only a few minutes.
sentences: Researching Available Bonds on E-Trade Log on at www.us.etrade.com.
If you do not already have an account, you will need to set one up.
The instructions are easy to follow.
Simply click on the green box that says Open An Account.
View the portfolio of bonds available for purchase.
These will include U.S. Treasury bills and bonds, government agency and corporate bonds, municipal bonds and certificates of deposit.
Use the Search function.
Go to E*Trade's Bond Center and click on the tab that says "Search current bond offerings."
Fill out the fields in the Quick Search form for a list of bonds that fit your requirements.
You can also use the Advanced Search option to further define your search criteria.
For example, you can limit your search to Treasury bonds or to bonds that will provide a particular yield.
Use the bond calculator.
When you select a bond that interests you, you can get a calculated price and yield for that bond to help you plan your investment.
Note the CUSIP number of any bonds that interest you.
This number will be needed to get information about a bond, get a quote or place an order.
It is a nine-digit number assigned by the Committee on Uniform Securities Identification Procedures.
Requesting a Bond Quote on E*Trade Submit a specific request for a bond quote.
This is not the same as placing an order or buying a bond.
Before you purchase a bond, you must get a price quote for it.
Click on "Get a Bond Quote" in the Bond Center.
This will take you to the same screen where you would place your order, but you are not doing that yet.
Enter the number of bonds you would like your quote to include.
Provide the CUSIP numbers for the bonds you are interested in.
Choose the "Offer Quote Request" option.
This will provide you with the lowest available bond prices.
Click on "Preview Quote Request."
Make sure all of the information is accurate, particularly the CUSIP number.
Once you have verified the information, click on "Place Order."
Wait for your quote to arrive on the "View Bond Orders" screen.
E*Trade will scan the markets and provide you with the information you need.
The process may take up to 15 minutes.
Placing an Order to Purchase a Bond on E*Trade Click on "Buy or Sell Bonds" in the Bond Center.
Decide whether you want to buy Treasury bonds at auction.
Buy Treasury bonds at auction by clicking on the "Treasury Auction" page and entering the number of bonds you want to buy.
Select the Treasury issue you wish to purchase from the list of options.
Preview your order and then click "Place Order" when you're ready.
Buy non-auction bonds by choosing the "Buy" option from the "Buy or Sell Bonds" page.
Enter the number of bonds you want to buy and input the CUSIP numbers.
Decide whether you want to make a market order for the bond at an unspecified price or set the price you want for the bond.
Input that number on the "Set Price" screen.
Pay attention to minimum-denomination requirements.
If the price you enter does not meet those requirements, you will be notified when you preview your order.
For example, you must buy a full bond, not a fraction of a bond.
They come in denominations starting at $1,000.
Some bond dealers require a minimum purchase of as much as $10,000.
Confirm the details of your order on the "Preview Order" screen and click "Place Order" when you are ready to buy your bonds.
Look for a SmartAlert.
Whether you bought Treasury bonds at auction or placed an order for other bonds, you will be notified of that trade as soon as it goes through.
It should take only a few minutes.
